Package net.xqhs.flash.core

Class DeploymentConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.config.Config
      • net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiValueMap
        • net.xqhs.flash.core.util.MultiTreeMap
          • net.xqhs.flash.core.DeploymentConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable
    public class DeploymentConfiguration
extends MultiTreeMap
    This class manages deployment configurations. It handles loading the elements of the configuration from various sources -- default values, arguments given to the program, or settings specified in the deployment file.

    The precedence of values for settings is the following (latter values override former values):

    • values given in DEFAULTS member;
    • values given in the deployment file.
    • values given as command-line arguments;

    The configuration is a MultiTreeMap containing a tree describing the entire deployment and a tree containing an index of all the entities in the deployment, indexed by a locally-generated id.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • loadConfiguration

        public DeploymentConfiguration loadConfiguration​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> programArguments,
                                                 boolean parseDeploymentFile,
                                                 ContentHolder<net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree> loadedXML)
                                          throws net.xqhs.util.config.Config.ConfigLockedException
        The method loads all available values from the specified sources.

        The only given source is the arguments the program has received, as the name of the deployment file will be decided by this method. If it is instructed through the parameter, the deployment file is parsed, producing an additional source of configuration values.

        The load() method can be called only once. It is why all sources must be given in a single call to load().

        Therefore, if it is desired to pick any settings from the deployment file, the boolean argument should be set to true.

        Parameters:
        programArguments - - the arguments passed to the application, exactly as they were passed.
        parseDeploymentFile - - if true, the deployment file will be parsed to obtain the setting values placed in the deployment; also, the XMLTree instance resulting from the parsing will be placed as content in the last parameter.
        loadedXML - - if the deployment file is parsed and this argument is not null, the resulting XMLTree instance will be stored in this ContentHolder instance.
        Returns:
        the instance itself, which is also the MultiTreeMap that contains all settings.
        Throws:
        net.xqhs.util.config.Config.ConfigLockedException - - if load() is called more than once.

      • postProcess

        protected static void postProcess​(MultiTreeMap elemTree,
                                  java.lang.String category,
                                  MultiTreeMap portableEntities,
                                  MultiTreeMap liftedEntities,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> context,
                                  MultiTreeMap rootTree,
                                  net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger log)
        Manages ported categories, auto-added entities and auto-generated parents (see CategoryName).

        For the moment, only categories declared in CategoryName can be ported, auto-added, or their parents auto-generated.

        The method follows the following steps:

        • from the current node, pick any entities that need to be ported from the node or automatically moved from the node to a deeper node (the latter are called 'lifted'); ported entities are only copied (in reference), lifted entities are actually moved.
        • any previously ported/lifted entities are placed in the current node, it the current node is a correct parent.
        • if any of the lifted entities has an ancestor that can be auto-generated as a child of this node, it is done so.
        • the method is called recursively for the child elements, passing the current list of ported / lifted entities.
        Parameters:
        elemTree - - the node of the current entity.
        category - - the category of the current entity.
        portableEntities - - configurations for entities that should be ported to their correct parents. The list contains entries which are category names, each category names containing trees with the configuration of various entities.
        liftedEntities - - configurations for entities that should be auto-moved to their correct parents. The list contains entries which are category names, each category names containing trees with the configuration of various entities.
        context - - the list of ancestor categories, above the current entity.
        rootTree - - the root tree (containing the entity list).
        log - - the Logger to use.

      • addContext

        protected static void addContext​(MultiTreeMap node,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> contextAbove)
        Goes through the deployment configuration and adds to each entities the local id of all the entities which for the context of this entities.

        More specifically, the "#local-id" of each of the entities containing this entity is added to the "in-context-of" attribute of this node. The first entry is the closest, and the last is the deployment itself.

        Parameters:
        node - - the node to configure.
        contextAbove - - the local identifiers of all the entities containing this entity.

      • readXML

        protected static void readXML​(net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode XMLnode,
                              MultiTreeMap catTree,
                              java.util.Deque<DeploymentConfiguration.CtxtTriple> context,
                              MultiTreeMap rootTree,
                              net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger log)
        Recursive method (recursing on XML nodes) which reads data from an XML (sub-)tree from the deployment file into the given configuration tree.

        While processing the current XML node the corresponding entity node is created. The category node must be created while processing the parent, so as to add multiple entities to the same category. The node will add itself to its context category. It also:

        • assigns names to entities, potentially auto-generated, based on the rules in CategoryName;
        • assigns contexts in the tree structure based on the value of the "in-context-of" attributes;
        • creates "in-context-of" parameters based on tree structure;
        • adds entities to the entity list, using the actual subtrees in the configuration tree;
        Parameters:
        XMLnode - - the XML node to read.
        catTree - - the configuration tree corresponding to category containing this node.
        context - - the context of the current node, down to the parent entity of this node.
        rootTree - - the root deployment tree, where identifiable entities should be added.
        log - - the Logger to use.

      • readCLIArgs

        protected static void readCLIArgs​(java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> args,
                                  DeploymentConfiguration.CtxtTriple baseContext,
                                  MultiTreeMap rootTree,
                                  net.xqhs.util.logging.UnitComponentExt log)
        Reads data from program arguments into the given configuration tree. The parser attempts to place the parameters in the correct categories / elements in the already existing tree (read from the XML) or introduce new elements at the correct places. The CLI arguments are parsed in order as follows:
        • if the argument is a category / entity ("-category"), its correct place in the tree is found, either by advancing in the tree or going upwards in the tree until in the correct context.
        • the category name must be immediately followed by the element name (may be new or existing).
        • what follows until the next category name are arguments of the form "parameter:value" or just "parameter".

        For integrating entities that are not already in the XML, a stack is used to keep track of the current position in the tree. The "current position" in the tree is decided by the existing tree (for existing elements and entities), by the hierarchy described in CategoryName, for known entities, and otherwise each new entity is considered as subordinate to the previous entity and for known entities the stack is popped until getting to the level where the entity appeared previously.

        Parameters:
        args - - an Iterator through the arguments.
        baseContext - - the CategoryName.DEPLOYMENT context entry.
        rootTree - - the configuration tree. The given tree is expected to already contain the data from the XML deployment file.
        log - - the Logger to use.

        protected static boolean isCategoryDefinition​(java.lang.String arg)
        Checks if the given command line argument designates a category (begins with "-").

      • addParameter

        protected static void addParameter​(MultiTreeMap node,
                                   java.lang.String par,
                                   java.lang.String val,
                                   boolean asSingleton,
                                   net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger log)
        Common XML/CLI functionality: add a parameter and its value to a tree; if already added as a single, overwrite. It is added as a multiple name by default.
        Parameters:
        node - - the node in which to place the parameter.
        par - - the name of the parameter.
        val - - the value of the parameter
        asSingleton - - if the parameter is a singleton value.
        log - - the log to use.

      • integrateChildCat

        protected static MultiTreeMap integrateChildCat​(MultiTreeMap parentNodeTree,
                                                java.lang.String subCatName,
                                                net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger log)
        Common XML/CLI functionality: retrieve or create a category node for a child entity inside the node of a parent entity.

        If the child category is unique, checks if there is an existing entity in that category.

        Parameters:
        parentNodeTree - - the node in which to integrate / from which to retrieve the category; the node should represent an entity.
        subCatName - - the category to integrate / retrieve.
        log - - the log to use.
        Returns:
        the node associated with the category; is a new node if the category was not pre-existing.

      • integrateName

        protected static java.lang.String integrateName​(MultiTreeMap node,
                                                java.lang.String categoryName,
                                                MultiTreeMap catTree,
                                                MultiTreeMap rootTree,
                                                net.xqhs.util.logging.Logger log)
        Common XML/CLI functionality: this method does the following:
        • if there is no existing name of the entity, attempts to generate a name based on other attributes of the entity (see name parts in CategoryName) and integrates the generated name in the entity's tree.
        • integrates the tree describing the entity into the tree of its category, if a category tree is given, under the given or generated name (or under the null name, if no name could be created. It is added as a singleton value or not depending on the value returned by CategoryName.isUnique(); the default (e.g. if no category data is found) is as a non-singleton value.
        • the entity gets a unique generated id and is added to the local id list.
        Parameters:
        node - - the tree describing the entity.
        categoryName - - the name of the category of the entity.
        catTree - - the tree describing the category of the entity.
        rootTree - - the tree describing the entire deployment.
        log - - the Logger to use.
        Returns:
        the name of the entity that was added.

      • getXMLNodeCategory

        protected static java.lang.String getXMLNodeCategory​(net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode XMLnode)
        For a node in the deployment XML, retrieve the name of the category of the entity that the node describes. Can be either the actual tag, or the value of the "type" attribute.
        Parameters:
        XMLnode - - the node to process.
        Returns:
        the name of the category of the node.

      • getXMLValue

        public static java.lang.String getXMLValue​(net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode node,
                                           java.lang.String searchName)
        Method to simplify the access to a parameter/attribute of an parametric XML node.

        Having the XMLTree.XMLNode instance associated with the parametric node, the method retrieves the first value found among the following:

        • the value of the attribute with the searched name, if any, or otherwise
        • the value associated with the first occurrence of the desired parameter name, if any, or otherwise
        • the value in the first node with the searched name, if any.
        Parameters:
        node - - the node containing the configuration information for the agent.
        searchName - - the name of the searched attribute / parameter / node.
        Returns:
        the value associated with the searched name, or null if nothing found.

      • getEntityList

        public java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> getEntityList()
        Creates an entity list, as a list of MultiTreeMap instances, each instance being the configuration of an entity.

        Each instance should contain:

        • a LOCAL_ID_ATTRIBUTE singleton parameter, having a unique local id as value.
        • a CATEGORY_ATTRIBUTE_NAME singleton parameter, containing the category (the entity type, for entities).
        • a CONTEXT_ELEMENT_NAME attribute, containing as values the local IDs of entities that the entity is in the context of, with the first being the 'closest' entity.
        • optionally, a NAME_ATTRIBUTE_NAME attribute, containing the name of the entity, potentially inferred from other attributes.
        Returns:
        the entity list.

      • filterContext

        public static java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> filterContext​(java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> entities,
                                                         java.lang.String contextLocalID)
        Filters, from an entity list (originally generated by getEntityList()), those entities which are in the context of the entity with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        entities - - a list of entities.
        contextLocalID - - the context to filter for.
        Returns:
        the list of entities which are in the given context.

      • filterCategoryInContext

        public static java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> filterCategoryInContext​(java.util.List<MultiTreeMap> entities,
                                                                   java.lang.String categoryName,
                                                                   java.lang.String contextLocalID)
        Filters, from an entity list (originally generated by getEntityList()), those entities which are in the context of the entity with the given ID and which are of a specific category.
        Parameters:
        entities - - a list of entities.
        categoryName - - the category of the filtered entities.
        contextLocalID - - the context to filter for.
        Returns:
        the list of entities which are in the given context and of the specified category.
